intro: Habracanthus charien, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a striking member of the Apocynaceae family. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a velvety texture. The flowers emit a strong, sweet fragrance to attract nocturnal pollinators like moths.
